TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CrowdManager extends Urho.Component

Docs.summary: Crowd manager scene component. Should be added only to the root scene node.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Navigation.CrowdManager which is tied to the .

MemberSignature.Value: public CrowdManager (IntPtr handle);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int handle) cil managed

Docs.param: Pointer to the raw unmanaged Urho object.
Docs.summary: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Navigation.CrowdManager, given a raw pointer to an unmanaged object

remarks.para: This creates a new managed wrapper for the type using the raw pointer to an unmanaged object.
Objects that are created in this fashion get registered with the UrhoSharp runtime.
This is intended to be used by the UrhoSharp runtime, and is not intended to be used by users.

MemberSignature.Value: public CrowdManager (Urho.Context context);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Urho.Context context) cil managed

Docs.param: The context that this object will be attached to.

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Navigation.CrowdManager linked to a specific .

MemberSignature.Value: protected CrowdManager (Urho.UrhoObjectFlag emptyFlag);
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Urho.UrhoObjectFlag emptyFlag) cil managed

Docs.summary: Empty constructor, chain to this constructor when you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.

remarks.para: This constructor should be invoked by your code if you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.
This essentially circumvents the default path that creates a new object and sets the handle and does not call RegisterObject on the target, you must do this on your own constructor.
You would typically chain to this constructor from your own, and then set the handle to the unmanaged object from your code, and then register your object.

.event class System.Action`1<valuetype Urho.Navigation.CrowdAgentFailureEventArgs> CrowdAgentFailure

Docs.summary: To be added.

remarks.para: The event can register multiple callbacks and invoke all of them. If this is not desired, and you only need a single shot callback, you can use the method. That one will force that callback and will ignore any previously set events here.

MemberSignature.Value: public Urho.Vector3 GetRandomPointInCircle (Urho.Vector3 center, float radius, int queryFilterType, uint* randomRef = null);

Docs.summary: Return a random point on the navigation mesh within a circle using the crowd initialized query extent (based on maxAgentRadius) and the specified query filter type. The circle radius is only a guideline and in practice the returned point may be further away.

MemberSignature.Value: public Urho.Vector3 Raycast (Urho.Vector3 start, Urho.Vector3 end, int queryFilterType, Urho.Vector3* hitNormal = null);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype Urho.Vector3 Raycast(valuetype Urho.Vector3 start, valuetype Urho.Vector3 end, int32 queryFilterType, valuetype Urho.Vector3* hitNormal) cil managed

Docs.summary: Perform a walkability raycast on the navigation mesh between start and end using the crowd initialized query extent (based on maxAgentRadius) and the specified query filter type. Return the point where a wall was hit, or the end point if no walls.

MemberSignature.Value: public Urho.Subscription SubscribeToCrowdAgentFailure (Action<Urho.Navigation.CrowdAgentFailureEventArgs> handler);
.method public hidebysig instance class Urho.Subscription SubscribeToCrowdAgentFailure(class System.Action`1<valuetype Urho.Navigation.CrowdAgentFailureEventArgs> handler) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("SubscribeTo API may lead to unxpected behaviour and will be removed in a future version. Use C# event '.CrowdAgentFailure += ...' instead.")

Docs.param: The handler to invoke when this event is raised.
Docs.summary: Subscribes to the CrowdAgentFailure event raised by the CrowdManager.
Docs.returns: Returns an Urho.Subscription that can be used to cancel the subscription.

remarks.para: This method will override any prior subscription, including those assigned to on event handlers.
This has the advantage that it does a straight connection and returns a handle that is easy to unsubscribe from.
For a more event-like approach, use the event.
